nomenclature.name: Calamus obovoideus
nomenclature.author: S. J. Pei & S. Y Chen
nomenclature.bibref: Evans et al., Rattans Lao PDR: 63 (2001)
nomenclature.type: China, Yunnan, Jinghong, Damenglong; S. Y Chen & S. Q. Tong; 620

div.p: Indochinese endemic, known only from the type locality, where it is rarely found (Chen Sanyang, pers. comm. 1999).

The fruits of this species are believed to be its best distinguishing feature and also the rachis is reported to lack spines abaxially. The presence or absence of spines on the knee is unlikely to be a reliable character (contra Wang 1997) since in closely related species this is a highly variable character even along a single stem.
Of high concern since it is known from only one site. At present this site is carefully managed for the rattans it contains (Chen Sanyang, pers. comm. 1999).
